instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, then replaced ISL 625 and now fan spins for 2 seconds
threads.message:
Hi there!

have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had corrosion around SIL 625 and only showed green light. . now have replaced that and the fan spins tempoarily and DC power supply indicates that it's going to boots but then goes back to dead

help appriciated

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, then replaced ISL 625 and now fan spins for 2 seconds
threads.message: maybe i should try another ISL?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, then replaced ISL 625 and now fan spins for 2 seconds
threads.message: Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>? My bet is liquid messed up your current sensing circuit causing quarter fan spin.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, then replaced ISL 625 and now fan spins for 2 seconds
threads.message:
AMAZING!!!! I checked resistance between 17/18 and resistance was crazy high. then i checked continuity between pin 18 and <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> and it had no connection. ran a jumper and BAM it's back. you helped us pay our rent this month.

THANK YOU
